From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
undefined to the saints, the faithful brothers and sis-ters in Christ, at Colossae. Grace and peace to you from God our Father!Paul’s Thanksgiving and Prayer for the Church
undefined We always give thanks to God, the Fa-ther of our Lord Jesus Christ, when we pray for you,
undefined since we heard about your faith in Christ Jesus and the love that you have for all the saints.
undefined Your faith and love have arisen from the hope laid up for you in heaven, which you have heard about in the message of truth, the gospel

undefined that has come to you. Just as in the entire world this gospel is bearing fruit and growing, so it has also been bearing fruit and growing among you from the first day you heard it and understood the grace of God in truth.
undefined You learned the gospel from Epa-phras, our dear fellow slave – a faithful minis-ter of Christ on our behalf –
undefined who also told us of your love in the Spirit.Paul’s Prayer for the Growth of the Church

undefined For this reason we also, from the day we heard about you, have not ceased praying for you and asking God to fill you with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,
undefined so that you may live worthily of the Lord and please him in all re-spects – bearing fruit in every good deed, growing in the knowledge of God,
undefined being strengthened with all power according to his glorious might for the display of all patience and steadfastness, joyfully
undefined giving thanks to the Father who has qualified you to share in the saints’ inheritance in the light.
undefined He delivered us from the power of darkness and transferred us to the kingdom of the Son he loves,
undefined in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.The Supremacy of Christ
undefined He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation,

undefined for all things in heaven and on earth were created by him – all things, whether visible or invisible, whether thrones or dominions, whether principalities or powers – all things were created through him and for him.
undefined He himself is before all things and all things are held together in him.
undefined He is the head of the body, the church, as well as the beginning, the firstborn from among the dead, so that he himself may become first in all things.
undefined For God was pleased to have all his fullness dwell in the Son
undefined and through him to reconcile all things to himself by making peace through the blood of his cross – through him, whether things on earth or things in heaven.Paul’s Goal in Ministry
undefined And you were at one time strangers and enemies in your minds as expressed through your evil deeds,
undefined but now he has reconciled 	you by his physical body through death to present you holy, without blemish, and blame-less before him –

undefined if indeed you remain in the faith, established and firm, without shift-ing from the hope of the gospel that you heard. This gospel has also been preached in all creation under heaven, and I, Paul, have be-come its servant.
undefined Now I rejoice in my sufferings for you, and I fill up in my physical body – for the sake of his body, the church – what is lacking in the sufferings of Christ.
undefined I became a servant of the church according to the stew-ardship from God – given to me for you – in order to complete the word of God,
undefined that is, the mystery that has been kept hidden from ages and generations, but has now been re-vealed to his saints.
undefined God wanted to make known to them the glorious riches of this mys-tery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
undefined We proclaim him by instructing and 	teaching all people with all wisdom so that we may present every person mature in Christ.
undefined Toward this goal I also labor, struggling according to his power that powerfully works in me.
For I want you to know how great a struggle I have for you, and for those in Laod-icea, and for those who have not met me face to face.

undefined My goal is that their hearts, having been knit together in love, may be encouraged, and that they may have all the riches that as-surance brings in their understanding of the knowledge of the mystery of God, namely, Christ,
undefined in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
undefined I say this so that no one will deceive you through argu-ments that sound reasonable.

undefined For though I am absent from you in body, I am present with you in spirit, rejoicing to see your morale and the firmness of your faith in Christ. Warnings Against the Adoption of False Philosophies
undefined Therefore, just as you received Christ Jesus as Lord, continue to live your lives in him,
undefined rooted and built up in him and firm in your faith just as you were taught, and over-flowing with thankfulness.

undefined Be careful not to allow anyone to captivate you through an empty, deceitful philosophy that is according to human traditions and the elemental spirits of the world, and not according to Christ.
undefined For in him all the fullness of deity lives in bod-ily form,
undefined and you have been filled in him, who is the head over every ruler and authority.
undefined In him you also were circumcised – not, however, with a circumcision performed by human hands, but by the removal of the flesh-ly body, that is, through the circumcision done by Christ.
undefined Having been buried with him in baptism, you also have been raised with him through your faith in the power of God who raised him from the dead.
undefined And even though you were dead in your transgressions and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, he nevertheless made you alive with him, having forgiven all your transgressions.
undefined He has destroyed what was against us, a certificate of indebtedness expressed in decrees opposed to us. He has taken it away by nailing it to the cross.
undefined Disarming the rulers and authori-ties, he has made a public disgrace of them, triumphing over them by the cross.
undefined Therefore do not let anyone judge you with respect to food or drink, or in the matter of a feast, new moon, or Sabbath days –
undefined these are only the shadow of the things to come, but the reality is Christ!

undefined Let no one who delights in humility and the worship of angels pass judgment on you. That person goes on at great lengths about what he has suppos-edly seen, but he is puffed up with empty no-tions by his fleshly mind.
undefined He has not held fast to the head from whom the whole body, supported and knit together through its liga-ments and sinews, grows with a growth that is from God.
undefined If you have died with Christ to the el-emental spirits of the world, why do you sub-mit to them as though you lived in the world?
undefined “Do not handle! Do not taste! Do not touch!”
undefined These are all destined to perish with use, founded as they are on human com-mands and teachings.

undefined Even though they have the appearance of wisdom with their self-imposed worship and false humility achieved by an unsparing treatment of the body – a wisdom with no true value – they in reality result in fleshly indulgence.Exhortations to Seek the Things Above
Therefore, if you have been raised with Christ, keep seeking the things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God.
undefined Keep thinking about things above, not things on the earth,
undefined for you have died and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
undefined When Christ (who is your life) appears, then you too will be revealed in glory with him.
undefined So put to death whatever in your nature belongs to the earth: sexual immorality, impurity, shame-ful passion, evil desire, and greed which is idolatry.
undefined Because of these things the wrath of God is coming on the sons of disobedience.
undefined You also lived your lives in this way at one time, when you used to live among them.
undefined But now, put off all such things as anger, rage, malice, slander, abusive language from your mouth.
undefined Do not lie to one another since you have put off the old man with its practices
undefined and have been clothed with the new man that is being renewed in knowledge according to the image of the one who created it.
undefined Here there is neither 	Greek nor Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave or free, but Christ is all and in all.Exhortation to Unity and Love
undefined Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with a heart of mercy, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience,
undefined bearing with one another and forgiving one another, if someone happens to have a complaint against anyone else. Just as the Lord has forgiven you, so you also for-give others.
undefined And to all these virtues add love, which is the perfect bond.
undefined Let the peace of Christ be in control in your heart (for you were in fact called as one body to this peace), and be thankful.
undefined Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly, teaching and ex-horting one another with all wisdom, singing psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, all with grace in your hearts to God.
undefined And whatev-er you do in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him. Exhortation to Households
undefined Wives, submit to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
undefined Husbands, love your wives and do not be embittered against them.
undefined Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is pleasing in the Lord.
undefined Fathers, do not provoke your children, so they will not become disheartened.
undefined Slaves, obey your earthly masters in every respect, not only when they are watching – like those who are strictly people-pleasers – but with a sincere heart, fear-ing the Lord.
undefined Whatever you are doing, work at it with enthusiasm, as to the Lord and not for people,
undefined because you know that you will receive your inheritance from the Lord as the reward. Serve the Lord Christ.
undefined For the one who does wrong will be re-paid for his wrong, and there are no excep-tions.
Masters, treat your slaves with jus-tice and fairness, because you know that you also have a master in heaven.Exhortation to Pray for the Success of Paul’s Mission
undefined Be devoted to prayer, keeping alert in it with thanksgiving.
undefined At the same time pray for us too, that God may open a door for the message so that we may proclaim the mystery of Christ, for which I am in chains.
undefined Pray that I may make it known as I should.
undefined Conduct yourselves with wisdom toward out-siders, making the most of the opportunities.
undefined Let your speech always be gracious, sea-soned with salt, so that you may know how you should answer everyone. Personal Greetings and Instructions
undefined Tychicus, a dear brother, faithful minis-ter, and fellow slave in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.
undefined I sent him to you for this very purpose, that you may know how we are doing and that he may encourage your hearts.
undefined I sent him with Onesimus, the faith-ful and dear brother, who is one of you. They will tell you about everything here.
undefined Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends you greetings, as does Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (about whom you received instruc-tions; if he comes to you, welcome him).
undefined And Jesus who is called Justus also sends greetings. In terms of Jewish converts, these are the only fellow workers for the kingdom of God, and they have been a comfort to me.
undefined Epaphras, who is one of you and a slave of Christ, greets you. He is always struggling in prayer on your behalf, so that you may stand mature and fully assured in all the will of God.
undefined For I can testify that he has worked hard for you and for those in Laodicea and Hier-apolis.
undefined Our dear friend Luke the physician and Demas greet you.
undefined Give my greetings to the brothers and sisters who are in Laodicea and to 	Nympha and the church that meets in her house.
undefined And after you have read this letter, have it read to the church of Laodicea. In turn, read the letter from Laodicea as well.
undefined And tell Archippus, “See to it that you com-plete the ministry you received in the Lord.”
undefined I, Paul, write this greeting by my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you.
